plugin.name: claim_listing
plugin.title: Claim Listing
plugin.summary: Allows to assign ownership for listings
plugin.author: Intelliants LLC

phrases.phrase: Automatic approval using email confirmation code
Approval by placing a specified file to the host
Do you really want to approve this claim? Take a note that by doing it, you are changing the owner of the listing.
Send an email as I have an access to this address and wish to own the listing.
Approve by matching emails of the user and listing
Your request will be approved automatically in case you have an access to the email address specified in this listing.
Approve by placing the file to the root folder of the website
We will ask you to place a file with the specific name into the root folder of the site
Your request will be manually reviewed by the site administration.
We are about to sent an email with the confirmation code to the email address :email. If you own this email, you will be able to use the approval link.

Please place an empty file named as in the box above and make it accessible via HTTP.

config.name: cl_enable_ftp_approval
config.description: Enable approval by FTP file upload

plugin.config:
Greetings,

Someone requested the ownership of listing submitted with the email {%EMAIL%}.

If you didn't do it, just ignore this email.

In order to become an owner of this listing, please proceed with the link: {%URL%}.

config.name: claim_approved_body
config.values: listing_url|URL of claimed listing,listing_title|Title of claimed listing

plugin.config:
Greetings,

Site administration has approved your claim request on the listing {%LISTING_TITLE%}.

You may now sign in to your account and edit the listing's data.

tooltips.tooltip: Enables the option to approve the claim by uploading a specific file to the website's root.
Enables the option to approve the claim using the confirmation code sent to an email specified for listing.

install.sql: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `{prefix}claims` ( `id` int(9) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, `date` datetime NOT NULL, `ip` bigint(12) NOT NULL, `member_id` int(11) unsigned NOT NULL, `item` varchar(40) NOT NULL, `item_id` int(11) unsigned NOT NULL, `item_title` tinytext NOT NULL, `item_url` tinytext NOT NULL, `type` enum('manual', 'email', 'ftp') NOT NULL default 'manual', `status` enum('pending', 'canceled', 'approved') NOT NULL default 'pending', `name` varchar(60) default NULL, `email` varchar(60) default NULL, `phone` varchar(16) default NULL, `job_title` varchar(20) default NULL, `notes` tinytext default NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`) ) {mysql_version};

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `{prefix}claim_pending_email_keys` ( `id` int(9) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, `date` datetime NOT NULL, `item` varchar(40) NOT NULL, `item_id` int(11) unsigned NOT NULL, `key` varchar(10) NOT NULL, `member_id` int(11) unsigned NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), UNIQUE `UNIQUE` (`item`, `item_id`) ) {mysql_version};

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `{prefix}claim_pending_ftp_filenames` ( `id` int(9) unsigned NOT NULL auto_increment, `date` datetime NOT NULL, `url` varchar(255) NOT NULL, `filename` varchar(35) NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (`id`), UNIQUE `UNIQUE` (`url`(255)) ) {mysql_version};
